intro: Leplaea, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. It consists of several species, many of which are native to southern Europe and the Mediterranean region. The plants typically have basal leaves and produce showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in early summer. They are often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Leplaea species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in rock gardens or as border plants.
